definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: This little present is for you as a token of our love. We hope you can use it.
sentences.chinese: 送你這個小禮物，聊表我心意，希望你能用得上。

sentences.english: Left, however, hoping go back to the place with you I am dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 純手工翻譯，希望能表達你的心意。

sentences.english: South Africa is not everything we would have hoped for, that's for sure.
sentences.chinese: 南非並非一切都合我們的心意，這是確定無疑的。

sentences.english: B: Yes. My mind is made up.
What are your favorite ways to save money while traveling?
sentences.chinese: 哪種旅遊省錢貼士最合你心意呢？

sentences.english: She want to prob my hurt, want to know I think.
sentences.chinese: 她試圖探查我的心意，想知道我在想什麼。

sentences.english: That was our small token of the contribution that we can provide to those who have suffered from this great tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 這是我們能向損失慘重的災區人民略表的一點心意。

sentences.english: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
sentences.chinese: 愚昧人不喜愛明哲，只喜愛顯露心意。

sentences.english: It has a good effect on life preservation and cure.
sentences.chinese: 心意太極拳對養生和防病治病有很好的功效。

sentences.english: It's a question of getting the right mix of policies to appeal to the electorate.
sentences.chinese: 問題是要有能投合選民心意的一整套相配得當的政策。

sentences.english: And he did evil, because he prepared not his heart to seek the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 羅波安行惡，因他不立定心意尋求耶和華。

sentences.english: Do you mind to phase, go home.
sentences.chinese: 相問君心意，結伴歸家鄉。

sentences.english: I put this on the intention to give her mother What is most perplexing .
sentences.chinese: 我把這點心意送給媽媽，媽媽傻了眼。

sentences.english: Your Majesty, this is Qing's own idea. My father knows nothing about it.
sentences.chinese: 稟皇上，是青女自己的心意，與家父無關。

sentences.english: He spent all his saving buying that house after his own heart.
sentences.chinese: 他用所有的積蓄買了那個特別合他心意的房子。

sentences.english: A mug of cold beer always hits the spot with me.
sentences.chinese: 對我來說，一大杯啤酒總是最合心意的。

definition: filial piety (a Confucian obligation)/respect and obedience to one's parents
goose feather sent from afar, a trifling present with a weighty thought behind it (idiom); It's not the gift that counts, but the thought behind it.
